Package homework1

Class RouteFormatter

java.lang.Object
homework1.RouteFormatter
Direct Known Subclasses:
DrivingRouteFormatter, WalkingRouteFormatter
public abstract class RouteFormatter
extends java.lang.Object
A RouteFormatter class knows how to create a textual description of directions from one location to another. The class is abstract to support different textual descriptions.

    RouteFormatter()

    Give directions for following this Route, starting at its start point and facing in the specified heading.

  • Constructor Details

    • RouteFormatter

  • Method Details

    • computeDirections

      public java.lang.String computeDirections​(Route route, double heading)
      Give directions for following this Route, starting at its start point and facing in the specified heading.
      Parameters:
      route - the route for which to print directions.
      heading - the initial heading.
      Returns:
      A newline-terminated directions String giving human-readable directions from start to end along this route.
      Requires:
      route != null && 0 <= heading < 360

    • computeLine

      public abstract java.lang.String computeLine​(GeoFeature geoFeature, double origHeading)
      Computes a single line of a multi-line directions String that represents the instructions for traversing a single geographic feature.
      Parameters:
      geoFeature - the geographical feature to traverse.
      origHeading - the initial heading.
      Returns:
      A newline-terminated String that gives directions on how to traverse this geographic feature.
      Requires:
      geoFeature != null
